# alicloud\_ecs\_auto\_snapshot\_policy\_attachment

Provides a ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment resource.

For information about ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment and how to use it, see [What is Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/doc-detail/25531.htm).

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.122.0+.

## Example Usage

Basic Usage

```typescript
import * as constructs from "constructs";
import * as cdktf from "cdktf";
/*Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.*/
import * as alicloud from "./.gen/providers/alicloud";
class MyConvertedCode extends cdktf.TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: constructs.Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    const alicloudEcsAutoSnapshotPolicyExample =
      new alicloud.ecsAutoSnapshotPolicy.EcsAutoSnapshotPolicy(
        this,
        "example",
        {
          name: "terraform-example",
          repeatWeekdays: ["1", "2", "3"],
          retentionDays: cdktf.Token.asNumber(cdktf.Op.negate(1)),
          timePoints: ["1", "22", "23"],
        }
      );
    const alicloudKmsKeyExample = new alicloud.kmsKey.KmsKey(
      this,
      "example_1",
      {
        description: "terraform-example",
        pendingWindowInDays: cdktf.Token.asNumber("7"),
        status: "Enabled",
      }
    );
    /*This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.*/
    alicloudKmsKeyExample.overrideLogicalId("example");
    const dataAlicloudZonesExample =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudZones.DataAlicloudZones(this, "example_2", {
        availableResourceCreation: "VSwitch",
      });
    /*This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.*/
    dataAlicloudZonesExample.overrideLogicalId("example");
    const alicloudEcsDiskExample = new alicloud.ecsDisk.EcsDisk(
      this,
      "example_3",
      {
        category: "cloud_efficiency",
        description: "Hello ecs disk.",
        diskName: "terraform-example",
        encrypted: true,
        kmsKeyId: cdktf.Token.asString(alicloudKmsKeyExample.id),
        size: cdktf.Token.asNumber("30"),
        tags: {
          Name: "terraform-example",
        },
        zoneId: cdktf.Token.asString(
          cdktf.propertyAccess(dataAlicloudZonesExample.zones, ["0", "id"])
        ),
      }
    );
    /*This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.*/
    alicloudEcsDiskExample.overrideLogicalId("example");
    const alicloudEcsAutoSnapshotPolicyAttachmentExample =
      new alicloud.ecsAutoSnapshotPolicyAttachment.EcsAutoSnapshotPolicyAttachment(
        this,
        "example_4",
        {
          autoSnapshotPolicyId: cdktf.Token.asString(
            alicloudEcsAutoSnapshotPolicyExample.id
          ),
          diskId: cdktf.Token.asString(alicloudEcsDiskExample.id),
        }
      );
    /*This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.*/
    alicloudEcsAutoSnapshotPolicyAttachmentExample.overrideLogicalId("example");
  }
}

```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `autoSnapshotPolicyId` - (Required, ForceNew) The auto snapshot policy id.
* `diskId` - (Required, ForceNew) The disk id.

## Attributes Reference

The following attributes are exported:

* `id` - The resource ID of Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment. The value is formatted `<auto_snapshot_policy_id>:<disk_id>`.

## Import

ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment can be imported using the id, e.g.

```shell
$ terraform import alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_attachment.example s-abcd12345:d-abcd12345
```
